Sports & Adventure
Sports & Adventure
Sports & Adventure
Cricket
A relatively new sport in Rwanda, the Rwanda Cricket Association was formed in 1999 and the game is now played by almost 5,000 individuals. About half an hour outside Kigali is the Gahanga Cricket Stadium, Rwanda’s first proper cricket ground, which opened in 2017.
Know more
Sports & Adventure
Cycling
Our land of a thousand hills is an excellent destination for off-the-beaten-track cycling, with almost endless trails and roads criss-crossing the territory. Exploring Rwanda's countryside on a bike is an authentic and rewarding way to interact with the rural population, with a huge dose of natural beauty.
Know more
Sports & Adventure
Kayaking
Exploring the coastline of Lake Kivu by kayak is a wonderful way to immerse yourself in the scenery, gazing up at the mountainous backdrop from the tranquility of the water.
Know more
Sports & Adventure
Hiking
Rwanda’s epic scenery, pleasant climate and magnificent wildlife make the land a remarkable place to explore on foot. The best hiking to be had is in the western half of the country, all the way from Volcanoes National Park in the north, along the fringes of Lake Kivu in the west and down to Nyungwe National Park in the south.
Know more
Sports & Adventure
Canopy Walkway
Suspended above a ravine in the lush montane rainforest of Nyungwe National Park, the canopy walkway provides an exhilarating perspective on the ancient treetops and wildlife.
Know more
Sports & Adventure
Caving
There are 52 caves in Northern Province. The most popular is Musanze Cave - the main cave has an entrance the size of a cathedral and is home to a sizeable bat colony.
Know more
Sports & Adventure
Helicopter Tours & Transfers
Based out of Kigali International Airport, Akagera Aviation offers charters or scenic tours by helicopter throughout Rwanda.
Know more
Sports & Adventure
Sabyinyo Hiking Trail
Rwanda’s epic scenery, pleasant climate and magnificent wildlife make the land a remarkable place to explore on foot. The best hiking to be had is in the western half of the country, all the way from Volcanoes National Park in the north, along the fringes of Lake Kivu in the west and down to Nyungwe National Park in the south.
Know more
Sports & Adventure
Golf
Golf is one of the emerging sports in Rwanda. In partnership with the private sector, the government has made substantial investments into the sport to tap into the lucrative global golf tourism market estimated at $44 billion.
Know more

                        <h2 class="grid_title">Cricket</h2>
            <p class="section_desc mt35">A relatively new sport in Rwanda, the Rwanda Cricket Association was formed in 1999 and the game is now played by almost 5,000 individuals. About half an hour outside Kigali is the Gahanga Cricket Stadium, Rwanda’s first proper cricket ground, which opened in 2017. </p>
                            <a class="btn btn_blue mt35" href="https://visitrwanda.com/interests/cricket/">Know more</a>
                    </div>
    </div>
</div>

                        <h2 class="grid_title">Cycling</h2>
            <p class="section_desc mt35">Our land of a thousand hills is an excellent destination for off-the-beaten-track cycling, with almost endless trails and roads criss-crossing the territory. Exploring Rwanda's countryside on a bike is an authentic and rewarding way to interact with the rural population, with a huge dose of natural beauty.</p>
                            <a class="btn btn_blue mt35" href="https://visitrwanda.com/interests/cycling/">Know more</a>

</div>        </a>

                        <h2 class="grid_title">Kayaking</h2>
            <p class="section_desc mt35">Exploring the coastline of Lake Kivu by kayak is a wonderful way to immerse yourself in the scenery, gazing up at the mountainous backdrop from the tranquility of the water.</p>
                            <a class="btn btn_blue mt35" href="https://visitrwanda.com/interests/kayaking/">Know more</a>

                        <h2 class="grid_title">Hiking</h2>
            <p class="section_desc mt35">Rwanda’s epic scenery, pleasant climate and magnificent wildlife make the land a remarkable place to explore on foot. The best hiking to be had is in the western half of the country, all the way from Volcanoes National Park in the north, along the fringes of Lake Kivu in the west and down to Nyungwe National Park in the south.</p>
                            <a class="btn btn_blue mt35" href="https://visitrwanda.com/interests/hiking/">Know more</a>

                        <h2 class="grid_title">Canopy Walkway</h2>
            <p class="section_desc mt35">Suspended above a ravine in the lush montane rainforest of Nyungwe National Park, the canopy walkway provides an exhilarating perspective on the ancient treetops and wildlife.</p>
                            <a class="btn btn_blue mt35" href="https://visitrwanda.com/interests/canopy-walkway/">Know more</a>

                        <h2 class="grid_title">Caving</h2>
            <p class="section_desc mt35">There are 52 caves in Northern Province. The most popular is Musanze Cave - the main cave has an entrance the size of a cathedral and is home to a sizeable bat colony.</p>

                        <h2 class="grid_title">Golf</h2>
            <p class="section_desc mt35">Golf is one of the emerging sports in Rwanda. In partnership with the private sector, the government has made substantial investments into the sport to tap into the lucrative global golf tourism market estimated at $44 billion.</p>
